org.stekikun.dolmen.debug

Interface Derivation.Displayer

  • Enclosing class:
    Derivation

    public static interface Derivation.Displayer
    This interface is used by Derivation.append(Displayer, Appendable) to allow the display of Derivation objects to be customized. The interface defines several callback routines which are called by the displaying engine and can be used to produce whatever structured output one wants from a derivation tree.

    It is guaranteed that the methods in Derivation.Displayer are called in a sequence X that follows these inductive rules:

    • either X is a single call to terminal(Appendable, short);
    • or X is a call to production(Appendable, short, short) followed by either of:
      • nothing if the production was empty;
      • a call to enter(Appendable) followed by any non-negative number of X, each followed by next(Appendable), ending with one X and a call to leave(Appendable).
    Author:
    St√©phane Lescuyer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Derivation.Displayer RAW
      An implementation of Derivation.Displayer which displays the derivations exactly as they are stored
